definitions.definition: to sit or stand with your legs on either side of something:
examples: He pulled on his helmet and straddled the motorbike.

definitions.definition: Something that straddles a line, such as a border or river, exists on each side of it or goes across it:
examples: Our farm straddles the railway line.

definitions.definition: to combine different styles or subjects:
examples: It's described as a new kind of dance music which straddles jazz and soul.

definitions.definition: to be unable to decide which of two opinions about a subject is better and so partly support both opinions:
examples: It's not the first time this year that the president has been accused of straddling an issue.
